definition: costume of minor characters in opera, featuring dragon designs/walk-on

to cover/to encase/cover/sheath/to overlap/to interleave/to model after/to copy/formula/harness/loop of rope/(fig.) to fish for/to obtain slyly/classifier for sets, collections/bend (of a river or mountain range, in place names)/tau (Greek letter Ττ)

sentences.english: He is just a small-time actor.
sentences.chinese: 他不过是个跑龙套的演员。

sentences.english: When the young man went to college, he decided to try out for the football team as a "walk-on."
sentences.chinese: 转眼少年进了大学，决心拼进校队，跑龙套也欢喜。

sentences.english: He started his acting career as an extra.
sentences.chinese: 他刚开始演戏时是一个跑龙套的。

sentences.english: To sing in the brother walk-on work.
sentences.chinese: 里给唱歌的哥哥跑龙套的工作。

sentences.english: Why will not Ron run while Wayne runs?
sentences.chinese: 为什么当韦恩跑龙套跑的时候，罗恩不跑呢？

sentences.english: But the this role of it occurred that oneself is stranger AN of Long Tao who gets luncheon box each daytime.
sentences.chinese: 但偏偏自己这个角色，是每天领盒饭的龙套路人甲。

sentences.english: He just walked on in the last act in this play.
sentences.chinese: 他只是在这部戏的最后一幕跑龙套。

definition: supporting role (in play, film etc)/minor role/to play a secondary role (in business etc)/to play second fiddle
to buy soy sauce/it's none of my business ("I’m just here to buy some soy sauce")
to appear on stage in an amateur capacity/(of a professional) to make a guest appearance/(fig.) to assume a role outside one's usual duties/to substitute for
substitute actor (esp. in fights of theatrical stunts)/stuntman
